solution_line_template: The two heavy washes will use {heavy_gallons_per_load} * {num_heavy_washes} = <<{heavy_gallons_per_load}*{num_heavy_washes}={heavy_total}>>{heavy_total} gallons of water.
The three regular washes will use {regular_gallons_per_load} * {num_regular_washes} = <<{regular_gallons_per_load}*{num_regular_washes}={regular_total}>>{regular_total} gallons of water.
The light wash will use {light_gallons_per_load} * {num_light_washes} = <<{light_gallons_per_load}*{num_light_washes}={light_total}>>{light_total} gallons of water.
The two bleached loads will use an extra {extra_light_per_bleach} * {num_bleached_loads} = <<{extra_light_per_bleach}*{num_bleached_loads}={bleach_extra_total}>>{bleach_extra_total} gallons of water.

In all, {heavy_total} + {regular_total} + {light_total} + {bleach_extra_total} = <<{heavy_total}+{regular_total}+{light_total}+{bleach_extra_total}={total_gallons}>>{total_gallons} gallons of water will be needed.
